alert.note: Alert for Charleston (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 25 at 7:22PM EST by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1030 PM EST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast South Carolina, including the following county, Charleston. * WHEN...Until 1030 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 722 PM EST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 0.5 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 1.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Mount Pleasant, McClellanville, Daniel Island, Fort Sumter, James Island, Isle Of Palms, Sullivan`s Island, Awendaw, Garris Landing, Bull Island, Price Inlet, Capers Inlet, Mount Pleasant Regional Airport, Lighthouse Island, Cape Romain, Cape Island, Boone Hall Plantation, Hampton Plantation State Park, Santee Coastal Reserve and Mount Pleasant Towne Centre.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
